subject: Politics
title: Propaganda and Revolution
description: A micro-lesson that makes Propaganda and Revolution usable.

hook.text: Lenin had Pravda. Hitler had Goebbels. Every revolution needs a story â€” and someone to tell it relentlessly.

buildup.text: Propaganda shapes how people see their government and the alternative. It makes revolution feel necessary.

discovery.text: Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense' sold 500,000 copies and turned colonists into revolutionaries.

twist.text: Social media is today's propaganda machine. Anyone can broadcast a narrative to millions instantly.

climax.text: Authoritarian states control media to prevent revolutionary narratives. Free media is their greatest threat.

punchline.text: Revolution starts in the mind. Propaganda is the weapon that lights it.

quiz.question: What role did Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense' play?
options: It convinced colonists that revolution against Britain was necessary
It argued for reconciliation with the British Crown
It was a scientific treatise with no political impact
